Upload Discard & download Back (don\'t do anything) Could not upload Some of or all the data was not uploaded. Try again later. The API responded with an error, please save your data and report the issue:\n\n Upload conflict Version conflict %1$s \nhas local version %2$d \nand was deleted on the server Element deleted locally but has references on the server %1$s \nwas already deleted on the server, retrying Local element references objects that are deleted on the server %1$s \ncaused unknown upload conflict \n%2$s Changeset unexpectedly closed, retrying Server version Local version Resolve conflict by… Resolve … by deleting the refering element … by using the local version … merging tags in to the local version … merging tags in to the server version … using the server version … undoing local delete … deleting references on server Unable to download referring element %1$s %2$d Unable to download referring element for deletion %1$s %2$d Unable to download server version %1$s %2$d Unexpected conflict type Missing referenced elements Still in use by elements Delete\nlocally Undelete\non server Upload failed Opening changeset failed.\n\nIt is safe to retry. Unexpected error trying to determine status of changeset %1$d. Unable to determine status of changeset %1$d.\n\nWe suggest saving your changes as an OCS file and determining what to do when you have better reception. No changes have been uploaded in changeset %1$d.\n\nIt is safe to retry. Changes were uploaded successfully in changeset %1$d, but result was not received.\n\nHowever it seems as if all changes were uploaded, so you can safely discard you local changes and re-download. Changes were uploaded successfully in changeset %1$d, but result was not received. Update failed Unable to update data. We suggest saving your changes to a file for later use. Re-download (can\'t be undone) Update local data (can\'t be undone) Save changes Issue: %1$s Could not authenticate If you are using OAuth this is likely a bug, please send a problem report, if you are using login and password (not recommended), please check that they are entered correctly. No connection to server Could not connect to the OSM server now. Please check that you are connected to the Internet, or try again later. Could not connect to the OSM server because HTTPS negotiation failed. Try switching to a non-encrypted connection in the API preferences. Could not authenticate If you are using OAuth, re-authenticate and try again. If you are using login and password (not recommended), please check that they are entered correctly. Re-authenticate Login forbidden Element not found The API couldn\'t find an existing element or changeset with the specified id.

Unknown error The error code returned from the API or the message could not be processed.

HTTP error code: %1$d
Error message:

%2$s No data The configured data source has no coverage here. Missing or disabled component This feature depends on a missing or disabled system component. Go to openstreetmap.org Version conflict Data from the download would conflict with your edits. Please upload your data before trying again. Corrupted data A data inconsistency has been detected. Before doing anything else, try to upload your edits, and then clear any stored data and re-download. Invalid bounding box The selected area does not conform to API restrictions, please choose a different one. Download area too large The area you are trying to download is too large or contains too much data.

Please zoom in farther and try again. API offline The API is currently offline, no data can be retrieved or written. Out of memory Vespucci could not load the requested data. Please start again and load a smaller area. Vespucci could not load the requested data. Please save your edits, start again, and load a smaller area. Invalid data received If you didn\'t cause the error, please file a bug report. Invalid data read Please consult the documentation on supported file formats and required data fields. Could not write to file Vespucci could not change or save the file. Applying the OSC file failed Most likely you have not loaded all the original data that is required to apply the changes. Download limits exceeded Please wait before trying to download more data. Upload limits exceeded You have exhausted your current upload allowance, please wait before trying again. Service unavailable The service is, likely temporary, unavailable, please wait before trying again. Duplicate keys You have added the following key more than once, this needs to be resolved before you can proceed: Auto download has been paused. Area too large for upload The area covering the changes you are trying to upload is too large.

Please split your changes in to multiple smaller changesets. You can do this by selecting a subset of changed elements and uploading them separately. Way needs at least one node A way you tried to upload has no nodes. This should not happen and the way has now been deleted so that you can retry. Please open an issue with the feedback form and independently submit the crash dump. Attempt to add too many way nodes The operation would create a way that contains more than the maximum number of way nodes. Either add less nodes or split the way at a suitable position. Trying to add %1$d nodes that would lead to a total count of %2$d nodes which is larger than the limit of %3$d Select file picker Welcome Thank you for installing Vespucci.\n

Vespucci is a powerful tool for editing OpenStreetMap. It supports nearly everything on mobile that you can accomplish with a desktop editor, this however comes with a certain level of complexity. The help pages on the device or online will answer most questions, if you need more support we recommend asking on Openstreetmaps community forum.

To get started you need to know three things:
  • tapping the lock icon in the upper left corner will switch between locked (no editing) and unlocked mode.
  • to add a new object tap the large green button and select what you want to add from the menu, then tap the position you want to locate it at.
  • to open the nearby point of interest display drag the handle above the bottom menu bar up.
On the next page you can set some initial preferences that will make your journey with Vespucci more pleasant. To improve your initial experience we can configure some options right now, you can skip this step and set individual preferences later if you want to. Display aerial imagery\nfor your current location Aerial imagery sources are provided by third parties and it is unavoidable that they can access your current network address and the location you are viewing. If you have privacy concerns don\'t select this and we will display the standard OpenStreetMap map as the background. Automatically download data "Automatically downloading OpenStreetMap data can cause significant mobile traffic. If you are using a metered connection you might prefer to not enable this and manually download data for the area you want to work on. Configure for pen or mouse usage If you are using a pen, a mouse or other pointing device, selecting this option will make editing more efficient. Authorize now You need to authorize Vespucci to upload to your OpenStreetMap account. If you have your login and password handy you can start that automatically when you have completed this form, otherwise the process will start automatically the first time you upload edits. Read the introduction Start! This is a new Vespucci version New features and behaviour are detailed in the release notes.

Important
Starting in June 2024 the OpenStreetMap API will no longer support Basic (login/password) and OAuth 1.0a authorisation.

If you have your login and password available it would be a good idea to migrate your API configuration and re-authorize now, but you can always do it later manually. Undo anyway Zoom to location, then undo Deselect any value above and then point your device in the direction you want to record, or drag the display to the value you want Point your device in the direction you want to record, or drag the display to the value you want Deselect any value above to use the number picker Deselect any value above to use the date picker Send with your OpenStreetMap display name OpenStreetMap display name not retrieved yet Feedback for the developers Download OpenStreetMap data Stop tracking and delete any stored trackpoints. This cannot be undone. Measure Did you know? Stop showing optional tips Long pressing the undo button will show all undo and redo checkpoints. Background and overlay layers are provided by third parties. Using a layer transmits your network address and a rough indication of the area you are looking at to the provider.

If the provider has supplied privacy policy information, you can view it with the \"Info\" menu item in the layer dialog. Mapillary is a service provided by Mapillary AB, Sweden, a subsidiary of Facebook. Using the service transmits your network address and information on which images you have viewed to the company. Panoramax is a service provided by third parties, the default server is operated by OpenStreetMap France, however you can change the server in the preferences. Using the service transmits your network address and information on which images you have viewed to the operator. Pan and zoom auto download should be used with caution as it has the potential to severely tax both the OpenStreetMap APIs and your device.

The load on the API servers can be avoided by using an offline data source. In locked mode you can\'t edit, but a long press on an object will open a display with detailed information. In simple mode a long press will not do anything. Turn simple mode off in the main menu if you want to use long clicks to create objects. Starting with version 15, GPX tracks no longer contain elevation information by default.

To enable elevation recording, install a Geoid model with Install EGM from the Tools menu, or switch to NMEA input. Merging and reversing OSM elements sometimes requires changing attributes on the elements, if there is a potential error or conflict you are alerted to this and are offered an opportunity to review the objects in question. Replacing the geometry of a way often requires moving the position of existing nodes, if these are tagged, that is they represent objects themselves, this might be undesireable.

To avoid this problem we extract nodes that are not within a small tolerance radius from the parent way and display a warning. You can adjust the tolerance (default 1m) in the advanced preferences. When you start GPX recording Vespucci collects location data to enable the GPX recording even when the app is not visible.

Explicitly closing the application or turning GPX recording off will stop the use of location data in such situations. When you start auto-downloading OSM data or tasks Vespucci utilizes location data to determine the current position even when the app is not visible.

Explicitly closing the application or turning auto-downloading off will stop the use of location data in such situations. You just touched a tristate checkbox, these work just as normal checkboxes, toggling between two values, for example yes/no or true/false.

However they have an additional third not set state, indicated by a greyed out checkbox which will stop the corresponding tag from being added. You can set the checkbox to this state with a long press. You just applied a preset that has links to alternative tagging. That is other ways to tag this object that may be more appropriate or may simply be related. These alternative presets will be shown at the top of the most recently used preset display. The lock button doubles as the mode switcher, a long press will show a menu with the different options.

You can find more information about Vespucci\'s modes in the help system, both in the introduction and the help for the main map display. Due to a quirk in the OSM API the starting point of the GPX track needs to be in view for it to be found for download. This mode currently doesn\'t support redoing node additions. Touch a highlighted node to determine the split position. A long touch will allow you to select which part is used for the new way in a further step. A closed way has to be split in two places. Touch a highlighted node to determine the 1st split position, the next step will ask you to select the 2nd position. When multiple OSM elements or other objects are very close together or elements are members of relations the disambiguation menu will be displayed. You can then select the specific element from the list.

If an element is currently already selected it will be highlighted. On devices running Android 10 or later we need to copy files to be able to access them fully. The copies are located in Downloads/Vespucci/imports. If necessary you can delete the originals and just retain the copies. WMS servers can support larger tile sizes than 256x256, consider using 512x512 for a more efficient configuration. Vespucci always adds an automatically created summary of what you uploaded.

You should still consider adding a few words on why you are making the edits to provide more context for other mappers. Always use a descriptive and unique filename, in particular not a camera generated one or else Wikimedia will reject the upload. + - 1 Vespucci default Default notification channel Vespucci QA QA alert channel for data problems and tasks Remember to upload your work You have one unpublished change. The selection contains ways with nodes outside of the downloaded area, which cannot be deleted without potentially creating an inconsistent state.\n\nDownload all of the area around the ways before trying again. Map overlay The tile based map overlay. Custom layers Manage layers not in the default configuration. Scale display Type of scale displayed on the map. Data style Choose the style for the data layer. Display tasks Display, edit and create notes, bugs and tasks. Enable photo layer Display geo-referenced photos. Keep screen on Prevent screen from turning off to save power. Large node drag area Provide large area for dragging nodes. Enable way node dragging Enables dragging of individual way nodes of a selected way. Advanced preferences More settings… Presets Add and enable JOSM compatible presets Built-in preset Validator settings Configure the validation rules. Connected node tolerance If a highway end node is within this distance (in meters) of a highway it should be connected to it Enabled validations Enable/disable individual validations Opening hours templates Load, save and delete opening hours templates Authors and licenses Debug About User interface settings Layout and display configuration options. Show node icons Show the icon of the best-matching preset above nodes. Show POI icons on buildings Show the icon of best-matching preset above buildings. Display tag form Display tag form for editing. Display labels from presets Display labels from presets in the tag form editor. Follow location button layout Where the "Follow location" button will be positioned. Always dim non-downloaded areas Dims non-downloaded areas in locked mode. Map screen orientation Behaviour of the map screen on device orientation changes. Show tolerance Displays area where an element can be selected. Use ← key to undo Use the ← key to undo in main edit view. Image licence Licence to use for uploaded images Theme Select app styling. Enable split action bar Show the menu buttons at the bottom of the screen. Requires starting Vespucci again, and Android 4.0 or later. App language Select non-standard app language Device language Max. number of inline values Maximum number of inline values displayed in tag form. %1$d values Time to wait before auto-locking Amount of seconds to wait before auto-locking, 0 turns it off. %1$d s Enable anti-aliasing Makes the lines smoother. Enable hardware acceleration Turn on use of hardware rendering on Android 10 and later. Max line width Do not draw a way thicker than this. %1$d px Pending upload OK limit If the number of pending object uploads is below this limit the situation is considered unproblematic. %1$d objects Pending upload warning limit If the number of pending object uploads is below this limit it will have warning status. A pending upload count above this will have danger status. Upload reminder interval Interval for reminders if you have unpublished changes. %1$d hours Too much data warning Limit (in number of Nodes) at which we start warning about too much data being loaded. Disable feedback activity Disable the feedback activity and use an URL instead. Beep volume Volume setting for beeps. %1$d Minimum zoom for Mapillary Minimum zoom level required before Mapillary data is displayed. %1$d Automatic capitalization of name tags on input Name capitalization Long string limit Limit from which to show a modal for editing text in the property editor %1$d Use volume keys for zooming Allow use of the volume keys for zooming in and out. Nearby POI display Set the keys used for the nearby POI display. Camera and images settings Show camera action Show camera icon on action bar. Camera app Select camera app to use. System default Open Camera FV5 lite FV5 pro Use builtin photo viewer Use the builtin photo view, if not checked an external viewer will be used. Additionally use the MediaStore for accessing photos Use the MediaStore Add images recorded with the camera button to the MediaStore. Add images to the MediaStore Configure destinations that can be used for storing images. Image storage Data and edit settings Auto-download, saving and notification settings. Always use contextual menu Always show the contextual menu if a selection is ambiguous. Override address tag default Use our address tag configuration over any region specific values Address tags Tags used for address prediction. Distance between neighbour addresses The distance up to which two addresses are considered to be potential neighbours %1$d meter(s) Enable name suggestions Turn on suggestions for the name tag. Enable name suggestion presets Automatically add preset when name suggestion is selected. Enable auto-apply of preset Automatically apply preset when starting the property editor. Generate notifications Generate notifications for data with problems or notes Group alerts only Only generate alerts (audio) for groups of notifications once Max. number of displayed notifications Maximum number of displayed notifications per type (min. 1). %1$d Notifications Max distance for notifications The farthest distance a problem or note can be from the current position to generate a notification. %1$d meter(s) Close changesets Close changesets by default upon saving. Enable auto-preset generation Allow generation of presets from taginfo. Squaring threshold The threshold in ° over which angles are ignored %1$d° Auto-format phone numbers Enable automatic formatting of phone numbers Max distance for stored imagery offsets The farthest distance a locally stored layer offset will be automatically be applied. %1$d meter(s) Use imperial units for measuring Use imperial units when measuring in countries that customarily use them. Minimum number of nodes in circle The min. number of nodes that should be aimed for in a circle. %1$d nodes Maximum circle segment length Maximum distance between two circle nodes. %1$d meter(s) Minimum circle segment length Minimum distance between two circle nodes. %1$d meter(s) Maximum distance to move tagged node Maximum distance to move a tagged node when replacing way geometry. %1$d meter(s) Min. way node count for move warning The minimum number of nodes a way needs to have to trigger the moved way warning. %1$d Min. way node count for visible node move warning The minimum number of nodes a way needs to have to trigger the visible node check and potential warning. %1$d Auto-download settings Settings for data and task auto downloading Download radius Radius (m) of externally triggered downloads, 0 centers only on map. %1$d meter(s) Maximum auto-download speed Limit (in km/h) above which auto-download is suspended. %1$d km/h Auto-prune Enable/disable automatically pruning in memory data and tasks Auto-prune limit Number of Nodes in memory that when reached will trigger a prune. %1$d Nodes Auto-prune Bounding Boxes limit Number of Bounding Boxes in memory that when reached will trigger a prune. %1$d Boxes Zoom limit Minimum zoom level for pan and zoom auto-download. %1$d Task filter Select which elements are displayed on the notes, bugs and task layer. Task download radius Radius (m) of task downloads. Maximum task auto-download speed Limit (in km/h) above which notes, bugs and task auto-download is suspended. Task auto-prune limit Number of tasks in memory that when reached will trigger a prune. %1$d Tasks Location settings GPS/GNSS parameters and other location providers. GPS/GNSS source Source of GPS/GNSS location updates. NMEA network source Address of TCP NMEA source as host:port. Minimum GPS/GNSS interval The minimum time interval for GPS/GNSS location notifications, in milliseconds. Lower values drain more battery. %1$d ms Minimum GPS/GNSS-distance The minimum distance between for GPS/GNSS notifications, in meters. Lower values drain more battery. %1$d meter(s) Leave GPS/GNSS turned off Don\'t ask to turn GPS/GNSS on if off. Fallback to network location If no GPS/GNSS positioning is present or turned on, fall back to network provider. Stale location after The age (in seconds) that a location needs to have to be considered stale. %1$d s Use barometric height Use height values in tracks from the air pressure sensor if available Server settings OSM API and configuration of other servers. OSM API URL Configure the URL and authentication method for the OSM API you are using User account You only need configuration to upload OSM data if not using OAuth. Get an account at https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/new Offset server URL for the imagery offset server. OSMOSE server URL for the OSMOSE server. Configure geocoders Add, edit, delete geocoders for the search functionality. Taginfo server Taginfo server to use for preset generation Overpass server Overpass server used for queries OpenAerialMap server OpenAerialMap server used for serving imagery Panoramax URL The base URL for a Panoramax instance without appended \"/api\" Layer download and storage Tile-based background imagery download and storage. Max. number of download threads Maximum number of threads for downloading tiles. %1$d Threads Tile cache size Total storage used for caching tiles, in MB. Prefer removable storage Prefer removable storage for the tile cache. %1$d MB Mapillary cache size Total storage used for caching Mapillary images, in MB Auto-save configuration Settings for the automatic saving of edits. Save state Save the complete state including unchanged data. Save changes Save changes as OSC file. Minimum interval Minimum interval in minutes between saves. %1$d min Minimum number of changes Minimum number of changes required for save. %1$d Maximum number of OSC files to retain %1$d Minimum GPX saving interval Minimum interval in minutes between saves of GPX recordings.
